p:
Viral conjunctivitis is highly contagious
1 ,5 . The virus spreads through direct contact via contaminated fingers, medical instruments, swimming pool water, or personal items; in one study, 46% of infected people had positive cultures grown from swabs of their hands
8 . Because of the high rates of transmission, hand washing, strict instrument disinfection, and isolation of the infected patients from the rest of the clinic has been advocated
9 . Incubation and communicability are estimated to be 5 to 12 days and 10 to 14 days, respectively
10 .
